segment.source: spinlock
segment.target: spinlock

segment.source: spinlock
segment.target: spinlock

segment.source: spinlock
segment.target: spinlock

segment.source: This action produces a text file listing information related to spinlock activity.
segment.target: This action produces a text file listing information related to spinlock activity.

segment.source: Options
segment.target: Options

segment.source: -summary
segment.target: -summary

segment.source: Summarizes spinlock event information in a tab-delimited format.
segment.target: Summarizes spinlock event information in a tab-delimited format.

segment.source: Maximum number of files to show.
segment.target: Maximum number of files to show.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Xperf spinlock analysis is available for 64-bit architectures.
segment.target: Xperf spinlock analysis is available for 64-bit architectures.

segment.source: Spinlock instrumentation is supported beginning with Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, and newer versions of the operating system.
segment.target: Spinlock instrumentation is supported beginning with Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, and newer versions of the operating system.

segment.source: Xperf supports normal spin locks and queued spin locks.
segment.target: Xperf supports normal spin locks and queued spin locks.

segment.source: For more information about spin locks, see Spin Locks.
segment.target: For more information about spin locks, see Spin Locks.

segment.source: To reduce overhead, ETW spinlock instrumentation is sample-based.
segment.target: To reduce overhead, ETW spinlock instrumentation is sample-based.

segment.source: The sampling frequency can be tuned with .
segment.target: The sampling frequency can be tuned with .

segment.source: For more information about starting spinlock sampling, see start.
segment.target: For more information about starting spinlock sampling, see start.

segment.source: To perform meaningful analysis, familiarity with WPA symbols is recommended.
segment.target: To perform meaningful analysis, familiarity with WPA symbols is recommended.

segment.source: For information on symbols, see Symbol Support.
segment.target: For information on symbols, see Symbol Support.

segment.source: If your test scenario is already running, it is not necessary to stop the scenario to collect spinlock events.
segment.target: If your test scenario is already running, it is not necessary to stop the scenario to collect spinlock events.

segment.source: You can start spinlock event collection while the code of interest is being actively exercised.
segment.target: You can start spinlock event collection while the code of interest is being actively exercised.

segment.source: Nor is it necessary to suspend your scenario when spinlock event data has been collected.
segment.target: Nor is it necessary to suspend your scenario when spinlock event data has been collected.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Large numbers of spinlock events may overload the trace buffers and cause events to be lost.
segment.target: Large numbers of spinlock events may overload the trace buffers and cause events to be lost.

segment.source: A message will appear when merging and loading the trace if this happens.
segment.target: A message will appear when merging and loading the trace if this happens.

segment.source: For more information about avoiding event loss, see Avoid Lost Events.
segment.target: For more information about avoiding event loss, see Avoid Lost Events.

segment.source: For more information about the spinlock action, see Customizing Spinlock Parameters.
segment.target: For more information about the spinlock action, see Customizing Spinlock Parameters.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: The following command example shows how to start a trace with spinlock data.
segment.target: The following command example shows how to start a trace with spinlock data.

segment.source: Spinlock event data can also be collected using only the "SPINLOCK" option, as shown in the following command example.
segment.target: Spinlock event data can also be collected using only the "SPINLOCK" option, as shown in the following command example.

segment.source: However, if the "PROCTHREAD+LOADER" options are omitted, symbol information is not available for decoding.
segment.target: However, if the "PROCTHREAD+LOADER" options are omitted, symbol information is not available for decoding.

segment.source: For more information about symbols, see Symbol Support.
segment.target: For more information about symbols, see Symbol Support.

segment.source: After event data has been collected into an ETL file, process the ETL file as shown in the following command example.
segment.target: After event data has been collected into an ETL file, process the ETL file as shown in the following command example.

segment.source: This produces a spinlock report.
segment.target: This produces a spinlock report.

segment.source: For information about this report, see Evaluating Spinlock Data.
segment.target: For information about this report, see Evaluating Spinlock Data.
